c74object.name: sp.novelty~
c74object.discussion: Open the Overview Patch The sp.novelty~ object takes audio input and outputs a bang, trigger, and a gate when novelty is detected. The novelty can be computed across different time frames and for different parameters.

inlet.description: Audio input to analyze for novelty.

outlet.description: bang output when novelty is detected.
Trigger output when novelty is detected.
Gate output when novelty is detected.

attribute.name: algorithm
attribute.digest: The feature on which novelty is computed.
attribute.description: The feature on which novelty is computed. Possible values: 0: Spectrum = The magnitude of the full spectrum. 1: MFCC = 13 Mel-Frequency Cepstrum Coefficients. 2: Chroma = The contour of a 12-band chromagram. 3: Pitch = The pitch and its confidence. 4: Loudness = The true peak and loudness

attribute.name: fftsettings
attribute.description: FFT settings consist of three numbers representing the window size, hop size and FFT size in samples: The hop size and fft size can both be set to -1 (and are by default), with slightly different meanings: For the hop size, -1 = windowsize/2 For the FFT size, -1 = windowsize snapped to the nearest equal / greater power of 2 (e.g. windowsize 1024 => fftsize 1024, but windowssize 1000 also => fftsize 1024) Constraints FFTSize, if != -1, will snap to the next greatest power of two if FFT size != -1, then window size is clipped at FFT size

attribute.name: lockout
attribute.digest: Amount of time (in ms) before it can get triggered again
attribute.description: Amount of time (in ms) before novelty can get triggered again.

attribute.name: offthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold of the novelty curve to reset, aka to allow the algorithm to trigger again.
attribute.description: The threshold of the novelty curve to reset, aka to allow the algorithm to trigger again.

attribute.name: onthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold of the novelty curve to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state
attribute.description: The threshold of the novelty curve to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state.

attribute.name: smoothing
attribute.digest: The size of the smoothing filter applied to the novelty curve (in ms)
attribute.description: The size of the smoothing filter applied to the novelty curve (in ms).

attribute.name: sensitivity
attribute.digest: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%)
attribute.description: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%). This is essentially a 'macro' parameter for the individual on/off thresholds of the novelty curve to consider it a segmentation point. It is important to note that each algorithm has a wildy different output range, so depending on the material and algorithm used you may need to manually tweak the on/off thresholds rather than using the macro 'sensitivity' parameter.

attribute.name: window
attribute.digest: The granularity of the window in which the algorithm looks for change.
attribute.description: The granularity of the window in which the algorithm looks for change in ms. A small number will be sensitive to short term changes, and a large number should look for long term changes. Constraints: Minimum = 30ms Maximum = 500ms *Although the values are taken in ms, it is internally quantized to an odd number of samples
